data.title: Polish Olympian sells Rio medal to save three-year-old battling cancer
Just 90 companies are to blame for most climate change, this 'carbon accountant' says
Swedish Government is offering migrants up to £3,500 each to leave
Italy sends migrants back to Sudan
Hungary planning 'massive' new border fence to keep out refugees

German military wants security checks on recruits, newspaper says: There are signs that Islamists are trying to join the German armed forces to get military training, and there is a risk they might use that training to carry out attacks in Germany or abroad, a paper cited a draft document as saying.
Singapore deploys thousands of mosquitoes in its war against dengue
Son of Russian lawmaker wanted for $170M in credit card scams, Roman Seleznev, captured by U.S. Secret Service agents at the Maldives airport on his way back to Russia
Turkey makes it legal for female police officers to wear headscarf

Ethiopia says Olympic marathon medalist a "hero", forever welcome back home. The champion runner did not return home after the Olympics, fearing for his safety even though the government said he would not be punished

Indian government, while declaring the Islamic Research Foundation (IRF) an ‘unlawful’ organisation, is set to slap terror charges on the Zakir Naik, whose ‘hate speech’ was reported to have inspired Dhaka cafe attackers. Last month, the Bangladesh government banned Naik’s channel Peace TV.
Solar panels have dropped 80% in cost since 2010 - Solar power is now reshaping energy production in the developing world
Ahead in polls, Dutch far-right party which leading polls vows to close mosques, ban Quran
Investigators in China say they have found no evidence that pollution caused hundreds of school pupils to become sick earlier this year.

Russia plans Internet overhaul to create secure state network: Under proposals by Security Council Secretary Nikolai Patrushev, Russia would create a new, independent Internet backbone, physically separate from the country’s preexisting Internet and public telecommunications systems.
